programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright reveals how bogus beggars are fleecing well-intentioned members of the public, and examines the extraordinary story of the fake landfill site that had locals up in arms. Plus, a report on counterfeit car insurance.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer 06 August 2015 BBC Two HD| Series 17 - Episode 57
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a three-bedroom house in Staffordshire and a flat in Newham, east London, and also revisit a Victorian villa in Derby. They then follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera 06 August 2015 BBC Two HD| Series 1 - Episode 3
programme.desc: A cyclist disappears under the wheels of an 18-ton truck, a 16-year-old gets stuck in a drain while trying to retrieve her mobile phone, and a camera captures the moment a woman is rescued from a live rail track. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search is on for relatives of a Korean War veteran who died in London, and as the case progresses the team is able to help someone meet family members she did not know she had. Plus, the story of a Shropshire woman whose collection of assets included jewellery with a very royal connection, and details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as Christina Trevanion and Paul Laidlaw help the red and blue teams hunt for treasures at the Mona Showground in Anglesey. They then head to Knutsford in Cheshire to watch the items go under the hammer.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid begins to wonder how well he knows the people he lives with, while Howard is forced to play by the book and Sean pushes Niamh's buttons.(n)

credits.actor: Dr Jimmi Clay : Adrian Lewis Morgan
Dr Zara Carmichael : Elisabeth Dermot Walsh

programme.title: The Link 05 August 2015
programme.desc: Three teams battle it out to spot connections between an increasing number of clues and break the links on cash pods to secure a place in the Super Link final, and the chance to take home the money. Quiz show, hosted by Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple who want to relocate to Cornwall and have a budget of Â£460,000, and gets a birds-eye view of Britain's largest rainforest at the Eden Project.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me 05 August 2015
programme.desc: EastEnders actress Natalie Cassidy talks to Brian Conley about her favourite TV shows from her childhood, including Only Fools and Horses, and University Challenge.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Series 12 - 13. Caroline Hawley v David Harper Showdown
programme.desc: David Harper and Caroline Hawley head for Paris, where Caroline hits the ground running with her fluent French and they challenge each other to a fashion face-off.(n)

programme.title: Pointless 05 August 2015
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: BBC London News 05 August 2015 BBC One| 05/08/2015
The Sheriffs Are Coming 05 August 2015
programme.desc: Craig and Tommy try to get money owed to a customer by a car dealer, while Lawrence and Kev are in a chocolate shop and will not leave empty handed. The sheriffs also attempt to recover a huge sum of money owed by a major credit card company, and deal with squatters holding up plans to redevelop a pub. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve contestants begin the battle to be named Britain's best amateur baker, facing tasks devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who have created 30 new tasks to test their baking skills and creativity. Their first signature challenge is to make a Madeira cake, before they attempt to bake a frosted walnut cake in the technical. Day two of the contest sees the contestants going all out to try and impress the judges with their first showstopper, the Black Forest gateau. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.sub-title: Series 1 - 1. Earth's Natural Wonders: Living on the Edge
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which cameras explore some of the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everest's notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of America's few surviving condor chicks.(n)

programme.title: BBC News at Ten 05 August 2015 BBC News Channel HD| 05/08/2015
BBC London News; Weather 05 August 2015 BBC One| 05/08/2015
Cashing In 05 August 2015
programme.desc: A year in the life of high-street second-hand retailer and pawnbroker Cash Converters. Workers from the successful Renfield Street store help their counterparts in Motherwell for a few days, and viewers are introduced to a third branch in Glasgow's Duke Street. Renfield Street manager Harry demonstrates his unique style of motivation in a bid to generate more sales, staff take on their biggest high-street rivals in a grudge football match, and a desperate customer tries to pass off a home-made lamp as a work of art. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Britain at the Bookies
programme.desc: The documentary concludes by exploring how Britain ended up with a 24/7 betting culture, and investigates what the future holds for the nation's gamblers. As political pressure about the dangers of betting mounts, the industry decides to get its own house in order, with the big four companies launching Gamble Aware Week, while lifelong punters Mitch and Roy talk about their struggles with addiction. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Former soldier Jason takes command of his military wedding to his bride-to-be Sacha. Having served in the army for seven years, he wants to celebrate the heroes of World War Two by getting Sacha to arrive at the wedding ceremony in an old war plane, then a tank. However, she is hoping his army days are behind him and is desperate for her big day to be a traditional, intimate event. With a mother-in-law to impress, and a bride hoping he will put her first, will Jason have to run for cover when his plans are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Great Ormond Street
programme.desc: Cameras follow the treatment of youngsters including Charlie, a nine-year-old with cystic fibrosis. In recent months his condition has deteriorated, so the medical experts, his family - and Charlie himself - will need to make a decision quickly. Meanwhile, Jess, 14, was told she should be listed for a lung transplant two years ago, but decided to take a risk and delay the operation. Has she left it too late? There are also profiles of 11-year-old Chloe and two-year-old Louie, who are both waiting for lung transplants.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: Journalist Myriam Francois-Cerrah travels to Bosnia to mark the 20th anniversary of the worst atrocity in Europe since the end of the Second World War when around 8,000 Muslim men and teenaged boys were massacred at Srebrenica. Myriam visits the site with delegates of British charity Remembering Srebrenica who were all born in the year of the genocide, where they learn how easily prejudice can take hold and why this story has important lessons for everyone in multicultural Britain today.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin examine a converted 16th-century chapel in Matlock, Derbyshire, a two-bedroom flat in Whetstone, London, and a water-damaged home in Wishaw, North Lanarkshire.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Presenter Nick Knowles meets a married couple who were catapulted metres through the air when a motorbike hit a car, presenting CCTV footage of the moment it happened, and finds out their story of rescue and recovery.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The detectives search for the relatives of a well-liked Essex woman without knowing the value of her estate, and hope that their gamble will pay off when the amount is revealed . Plus, a case from the archives telling the story of one family's escape from war-torn Burma, and details of unclaimed estates.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A round-up of the summer's deaf sporting events, including the European Deaf Football Championships in Hanover and the World Deaf Tennis Championships in Nottingham. With voiceover.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow Detectives
programme.desc: Marc Allum investigates the story of RMS Carpathia, the ship that went to the rescue of RMS Titanic in 1912, and brings together two of the captain's relatives. Fiona Bruce presents the show exploring intriguing tales connected to items featured on the main BBC One show.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme in which the award-winning broadcaster presents breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines.(n)

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant explores the work of Victorian photographer Francis Frith, who undertook a project to record as much of the UK as possible during the 19th century. Sergeant begins in London, where he discovers the inspiration behind My Fair Lady, meets the first female Chelsea Pensioner, and ventures deep under Tower Bridge to explore examples of Victorian engineering.(n)

programme.title: Railways of the Great War with Michael Portillo
programme.desc: The former MP gets hands-on experience of the miniature tracks and trains that kept supplies flowing to the front line during the First World War. Michael visits Quintinshill, near Gretna Green, which in 1915 was the site of Britain's deadliest train crash, and heads to northern France to discover how the railways fed millions of men in the trenches from a depot in Abancourt.(n)

programme.title: The Rockford Files
programme.sub-title: Series 5 - 8. A Good Clean Bust with Sequel Rights
programme.desc: Jim ends up as piggy-in-the-middle between a client trying to become a TV celebrity and crooks who are out to make a hit - no matter who is in their way. Detective drama, starring James Garner.(n)

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Jennie Bond and Jonty Hearnden visit Debbie Douglas's Birmingham home as they try to find valuables that can be sold to raise money for some new storage space.(n)

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker schemes to ensure a steady supply of alcohol is on hand during a visit to an Arab state - but wife Annie leaves him open to allegations of corruption by accepting a valuable gift from a local dignitary. Paul Eddington and Diana Hoddinott star.(n)

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and his personnel are forced to pose as the Excelsior Quartet at the chateau. Second World War comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.(n)

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe's beloved cat goes missing, so she turns to Mr Humphries for support in her hour of need. Fearing the feline may never return, the staff buy her a kitten. John Inman and Mollie Sugden star.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming
programme.sub-title: Live Swimming: World Championships: 2015 Day Four
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day four from Kazan Arena in Russia, including the finals of the men's 200m butterfly, 50m breaststroke and 800m freestyle, and women's 200m freestyle and 4x100m mixed medley relay.(n)
programme.episode-num: Live Swimming: World Championships: 2015 Day Four

programme.title: Two Tribes 05 August 2015 BBC Two HD| Series 2 - Episode 48
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads 05 August 2015 BBC Two HD| Series 12 - Episode 131
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Asian Adventure
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King visit beaches and mountains in Thailand and discover how the country's multicultural history and its place at the heart of the spice trade have helped create a rich and varied cuisine. They taste a traditional Thai breakfast and cook their own jungle curry for a remote hill tribe.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: As the cooking challenge continues, Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell attempt to create the perfect main course, under the watchful eye of a panel of judges. Self-taught Jimmy is honouring his mum with his rendition of her Chinese beef stew, while Jak and Graham aren't resting on their laurels as they go all out for top scores in the battle to reach the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: The Trouble with Space Junk
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the scale of the problem of debris in space, with Earth surrounded by hundreds of millions of items moving at 17,000 miles per hour. The International Space Station had to move three times in 2014 to avoid potentially lethal chunks of junk and the Horizon team reveals how the US government is investing $1 billion to track space debris, while companies around the world are developing ways to clear up the mess, from nets and robot arms to harpoons.(n)
programme.episode-num: Horizon: The Trouble with Space Junk

programme.title: Signed, Sealed, Delivered: Inside the Post Office
programme.desc: The behind-the-scenes look at the Post Office continues as General Manager Michael Larkin embarks on a radical plan for the Post Office to turn its fortunes around by pushing into the financial services industry. But, while the ambitious plan to fill the gap left by the big banks closing high street branches offers hope of a more lucrative future for larger establishments, the proposals could result in smaller outlets offering fewer services, a fact that some postmasters are finding hard to swallow.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Host Stephen Fry begins the `K' series with a range of fiendish questions on the topic of knees and knockers. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Sara Pascoe, Jack Whitehall and David Mitchell, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight 05 August 2015 BBC Two HD| 05/08/2015
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for Dinner
programme.desc: The Robshaws are transported back to the space-age 1960s, with their home having a fitted kitchen installed and a host of new tastes and flavours to be sampled. Giles Coren and Polly Russell introduce them to the culinary treats of the decade, including spaghetti bolognese and TV dinners, while Hairy Biker Dave Myers delivers their long-awaited fridge and reveals the transformative effect the appliance had on his own childhood. Giles also discovers how chicken went from an expensive treat to an everyday staple.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Don't Blow the Inheritance
programme.desc: Quiz show in which teams made up of two generations of the same family compete for a cash prize. Parents build up a prize fund by answering general knowledge questions until one pair makes it into the final, where the son or daughter must answer the final questions correctly and avoid wasting their mother or father's work. Presented by Tim Vine.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Brendan Cole chats about getting to grips with sheep herding in Flockstars, plus a look at the latest events in Emmerdale's big summer episodes.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Jenni Falconer.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford.(n)

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford.(n)

programme.title: Guess This House 05 August 2015 UTV Ireland| Series 1 - Episode 8
programme.desc: Property game show hosted by Saira Khan in which two couples compete to win Â£2,000 by correctly guessing the value of the houses they are shown round.(n)

programme.title: ITV News and Weather 05 August 2015 STV + 1| 05/08/2015
ITV News London 05 August 2015 ITVHD London| 05/08/2015
Dickinson's Real Deal 05 August 2015
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public sort the treasures from their trash, offering them the chance to put items up for auction or accept a cash sum.(n)

programme.title: Secret Dealers 05 August 2015 UTV| Series 5 - Episode 8
programme.desc: Dealers David Ford, Mike Melody and Simon Schneider can hardly believe their eyes as they scout around Tony and Helen's Warwickshire cottage, which is home to a stunning collection of art nouveau and antiques from the early 20th century, and a Liberty chamberstick by famed British designer Archibald Knox hots up the bidding. In the second home, Karen Dalmeny and Alison Chapman do battle for a collection of 1930s Hornby trains.(n)

programme.title: ITV London Weather 05 August 2015 ITVHD London| 05/08/2015
Hello Campers
programme.desc: The latest stage of the competition sees the five couples have an Italian language lesson in Tuscany, while one couple take a risk by cooking an Italian dinner for their campmates.(n)

programme.title: Freeze Out 05 August 2015
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of Â£10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.(n)

programme.title: ITV News London 05 August 2015 ITVHD London| 05/08/2015
Emmerdale 05 August 2015
programme.desc: The wedding party is stunned into silence as they come to terms with the full horror of what has just taken place. The emergency services are called in, while James and Emma race to the rescue. Adam wakes up to find himself in mortal danger.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street 05 August 2015 UTV Ireland| Episode 8701
programme.desc: Carla is devastated to discover Roy knows the truth about her trip abroad, and a stunned Nick watches her gamble away hundreds of pounds in the casino. Meanwhile, Bethany and Kylie quiz Sarah on her split from Callum, Kevin helps lift Sally's spirits, and Leanne agrees to give Robert a trial in the Bistro kitchen. Elsewhere, Eileen and Michael sell the bracelet they've found to Todd at Barlow's Buys, but panic when they discover it belonged to Deirdre.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into the strange murder of eminent art historian Professor Van Haren, who was really a former high-ranking Nazi hired by MI5 due to his expert knowledge of Soviet intelligence. Meanwhile, as Sam's husband Adam embarks on a busy career as an MP, she worries whether she will be able to share some big news with him. Crime drama set in the 1940s, starring Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks, with Tamzin Outhwaite and Rupert Vansittart.(n)

credits.actor: Lt Colonel Hoyt Jackson : Colin Stinton

programme.title: ITV News at Ten and Weather 05 August 2015
ITV News London 05 August 2015 ITVHD London| 05/08/2015
Cilla 05 August 2015 UTV Ireland| Series 1 - Episode 2
programme.desc: Reunited with Bobby, Cilla's confidence returns and she once again dazzles crowds with her vocal talents. The re-emergence of impresario Brian Epstein then propels her career to greater heights, but this is quickly followed by a new low when her first record fails to set the charts alight, despite being written by two local lads called John Lennon and Paul McCartney. Epstein suggests a change of direction, persuading the singer to take a gamble on the ballad Anyone Who Had a Heart, against her future husband's advice. Continuing Jeff Pope's three-part biopic charting Cilla Black's rise to fame in 1960s Liverpool, starring Sheridan Smith, with Aneurin Barnard and Ed Stoppard.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point 05 August 2015
programme.desc: Quiz show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica takes over a congressman's seat in Washington while trying to find out who was responsible for his murder - but political shenanigans and sinister goings-on conspire to keep her from solving the crime. Mystery, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: KOTV Boxing Weekly
programme.desc: Sam Eggington v Joseph Lamptey. Highlights of the Commonwealth Welterweight title bout at Barclaycard Arena in Birmingham, plus action from the archive and a round-up of results.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: Featuring World Rally Championship action from Finland, a look at how to design a world class show jumping course, and a lesson in badminton with Mathias Boe and Carsten Mogensen.(n)

programme.title: The Grid
programme.desc: The Le Mans 24 Hour-winning Porsche team practice their pit stops, plus highlights of the Spa 24 Hours and profiles of the Formula 4 drivers.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: Rachael Latham and JJ Chalmers present highlights from Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park in London, where fans of parasport where given a chance to meet some of the stars and experience some of the events themselves. Plus, action from swimming meet held at the Aquatics Centre, with commentary by Giles Long and Paul Noble, and analysis from Liz Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money 06 August 2015 4seven HD| Series 1 - Episode 4
programme.desc: Surrey couple Stuart and Fiona Allan are desperate for more space and have saved for nine years to transform their property into a New England-style dream house. Meanwhile in Liverpool, Vicky Holmstock hopes to give her Grade II-listed windmill a luxury makeover and has submitted five planning applications - but still doesn't have her permission finalised. Sarah Beeny tries to make a success of both projects and save the homeowners money along the way.(n)

programme.title: You Deserve This House
programme.desc: A community hero is taken away for the weekend while professional designers, decorators and those who the homeowner has helped down the years carry out a property makeover. In the first episode, Special Olympics gymnastics coach Jane Whetnall is whisked away for a spa break, while the children and families she has worked with transform her home. Presented by Amanda Lamb.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Short highlights from Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's adventures at the smallholding, revealing the secrets to whipping up simple culinary treats.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final - when a Â£40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Gethin Jones in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: A brush with death prompts Grace to write her will. Determined to do things properly, she enlists Will's legal expertise to make sure she is fair when bequeathing her money. Meanwhile, Jack is forced to reassess his teaching methods. Eric McCormack and Debra Messing star.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me 05 August 2015 Channel 4 HD| Series 1 - Episode 18
programme.desc: Three sets of dinner-party hosts from Nottingham compete, beginning with Ollie and his girlfriend Deb, who think their holiday-inspired menu has what it takes to win. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes a doting father and decides to spend quality time with his youngest daughter when he discovers Santa's Little Helper knows Maggie better than he does. programme.title: Hollyoaks 05 August 2015 Channel 4 HD| Episode 4184
programme.desc: Patrick extends what seems to be an olive branch to Darren, who remains jealous of Mr Blake's closeness with Maxine, but when his friendly gesture is turned aside a little more violently than expected, the truth about Patrick's health is momentarily revealed. programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free 05 August 2015 Channel 4 HD| 05/08/2015
programme.desc: After challenging the nation to fill their houses for free, and having directly helped 20 families transform dozens of rooms, saving them tens of thousands of pounds, Kirstie Allsopp and her team of free pioneers - Max McMurdo, Lee Baker and Charis Williams - conduct a room-by-room guide to some of their favourite furniture transformations and upcycles. programme.title: One Born Every Minute 05 August 2015 Channel 4 HD| Series 8 - Episode 3
programme.desc: Rhiannon, who has cystic fibrosis, prepares to risk her life to have a third child, while an unexpected turn of events during labour means Kirsty and her partner, retired soldier Ian, must alter their birth plan. Plus, single mum SammiJo relies on her mum to help her bond with her second baby in a way she couldn't when her first child was born.(n)

programme.title: Witnesses 05 August 2015 Channel 4 HD| Series 1 - Episode 3
programme.desc: Sandra Winckler and Paul Maisonneuve discover more carefully arranged corpses at a new show home location, and clues are uncovered that place Paul's family in danger. As the race to track down Kaz Gorbier and his accomplices continues, Sandra grows increasingly suspicious of Paul and takes matters into her own hands to find out what he could have done to provoke Gorbier into embarking on his sinister revenge plot. In French.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: Every bride dreams of the perfect wedding day, but what happens when the groom is in prison? Last year, in California alone, more than 1,800 weddings took place behind bars, and this documentary follows the stories of three American women who have decided to tie the knot while their partners are serving time. Negotiating a myriad regulations and restrictions, the couples must follow strict dress codes, walk down the aisle via an X-ray machine and kiss each other through bulletproof glass.(n)

programme.title: Poker

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: Featuring World Rally Championship action from Finland, a look at how to design a world class show jumping course, and a lesson in badminton with Mathias Boe and Carsten Mogensen.(n)

programme.desc: The Le Mans 24 Hour-winning Porsche team practice their pit stops, plus highlights of the Spa 24 Hours and profiles of the Formula 4 drivers.(n)

programme.title: The Holiday Airport: Sun, Sea & Scousers
programme.desc: Grand National fever hits the airport as hundreds of excited race-goers pass through for the annual steeplechase. A skateboarding crew from Herefordshire are en route to Barcelona, but when it turns out some of them have a fear of flying, it seems they might not get very far, while a woman who has lost more than eight stone fuels up at the airport restaurants and bars before flying out to Palma for the sporting challenge of a lifetime. The fire crews join other emergency personnel from Merseyside for a training exercise, and the opening of an airport gym sparks rivalry between staff.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: Volunteers for the Wildlife Aid Rescue Centre come to the aid of a heron, a grass snake and newborn hedgehogs.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow profiles scientist, engineer, inventor and painter Leonardo da Vinci, whose extraordinary artistic genius gave rise to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, the Annunciation and the Last Supper. Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Design guru Ann Maurice visits a house with an unsightly pile of brick rubble, investigates a property whose garden is a potential death trap, and delivers her verdict on a conservatory used to store laundry in this compilation of highlights from the series.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation of highlights from the home improvement series, featuring bedroom and bathroom makeovers by Californian designer Ann Maurice.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: A pink mansion in Edinburgh gets a makeover from Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton. They attempt to give the garishly painted home a more traditional Scottish feel by having it professionally redecorated and toning down the dark, oppressive wooden ceiling over the hallway.(n)

programme.title: The WotWots
programme.desc: The aliens become fascinated by a kite they see flying at the beach and investigate what other objects can move using wind power. Narrated by Nicholas Parsons.(n)

programme.title: Igam Ogam
programme.desc: The cave girl tries to hide and only replies when her name is called.(n)

programme.title: Lily's Driftwood Bay
programme.desc: A washed-up ribbon inspires Lily to teach Salty how to fly a kite. After one-too-many disasters, Lily learns that Salty is more confident at sea and comes up with a plan to help.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mike gets trapped in Bronwyn's basement with a leaky pipe and a broken door handle blocking his escape - and they need to get out in time to make the evening karaoke event.(n)

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: When a strange wailing noise turns out to be the harbour master?s terrible singing, Toot is determined to help him sing in tune.(n)

programme.desc: Mummy Pig buys a new cupboard for all the toys.(n)

programme.desc: Aubrey the snail is upset when his dad wants him to become a footballer, as all he wants to do is dance - so Pip and Alba arrange for him to show his dancing skills during a match.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster is unhappy to discover she has nits and everyone makes sure they keep out of her way. Narrated by Julian Clary.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Nervous finds out more about the universe at a planetarium.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas takes over from Victor at the steam works, but does not pay enough attention to instructions.(n)

programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet and his friends search for buried treasure of a very peculiar kind.(n)

programme.desc: Mr Wobbly Man borrows Whiz's control-it-all gadget to solve a problem.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly breaks her mother's new teapot, and Ben helps her try to repair it.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig brings home a video camera and Peppa gets to see herself on TV.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family go to a funfair, where Mummy Pig tries to win a giant teddy.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The playgroup puts on a play and Peppa gets to be Little Red Riding Hood.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box
programme.desc: Kemi and Amy zoom off into outer space and discover some amazing planets in this astronomical bop.(n)

programme.title: Toby's Travelling Circus
programme.desc: The circus moves camp, but Clara is left behind. When Tony realises that she is missing, he sets off to find her.(n)

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: Morgan finds a book on bears and decides that he no longer wants to be a teddy. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Dominic Wood and Richard McCourt.(n)

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: When Hopparoo bursts all the twins' bubbles with his ears, they use McCoggins' extra-strong mixture instead - with disastrous results.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and his guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: Cowboy Builders
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Melinda Messenger head to Guildford, Surrey, where they revisit Simon and Diane Saulis. The couple bought a detached house with a view to extending it, but the builder they hired disappeared with most of their money after completing only half the work.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: An insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of people who owe money, their creditors and those who collect the payments. High court eviction officer Kevin Stokes faces a physical assault, while Paul Bohill and his team deal with a difficult case involving a mother and daughter who are about to be left out on the street with nowhere to go. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team heads into the Arizona desert to locate an artist who might be able to help solve the murder of fellow agent Jack Patterson - and discovers one of her paintings holds the key to the mystery. Meanwhile, DiNozzo learns he is in line for an inheritance.(n)

programme.title: Flirting with Danger
programme.desc: Mystery thriller starring Charisma Carpenter and James Thomas. Rafe Marino suspects foul play when his friend Tommy dies young of a heart attack. He begins his own investigation and finds himself drawn to a woman with whom Tommy was associated.(n)

programme.desc: Emma Crosby presents a round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories, presented by Matt Barbet.(n)

programme.title: Trauma Doctors 05 August 2015 Channel 5| Series 2 - Episode 3
programme.desc: A 20-year-old French student is rushed to the Royal London Hospital in Whitechapel after being stabbed just under his left armpit, and the air ambulance delivers a snooker-club manager who fell 10ft through plastic roofing and landed on his head. After an ambulance is held up by rush-hour traffic, a trauma doctor has to stop the vehicle to carry out a delicate operation to save her patient's life.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door 05 August 2015 Channel 5| Series 4 - Episode 2
programme.desc: Featuring two quarrelling neighbours who record each other's every moment on CCTV and in diaries. Their dispute began when Thomas parked his caravan on a quiet cul-de-sac, much to the annoyance of his neighbour Mrs Potter. Plus, how a shared driveway pushed Susie to breaking point when her neighbour Grant put her young daughter at risk. Susie decided to install gates across the drive and use it for family barbecues, but Grant took matters into his own hands and it ended in a trip to the police station for him.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Benefits Cheat 05 August 2015 Channel 5| Series 1 - Episode 1
programme.desc: Investigative reporter Paul Connolly goes undercover to secretly film people who are falsely claiming benefits and those who help them cheat the system, before confronting them with the evidence he has gathered. He begins by unearthing people who claim sickness benefits while faking illnesses and discovers the cunning ways in which they can trick some doctors into signing them off. He also encounters conmen who can supply anything a benefit cheat needs to scam the system, including fake utility bills, driving licences and sick notes.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Cindy Lou threatens a vulnerable and desperate Franky with a severe beating unless she finds a new drugs supply within 24 hours. Too proud to accept Bea's help, she tries to deal with the situation herself, but ends up damaging her parole chances. Meanwhile, Bea tries to make amends for the way she treated Liz and Boomer, and is shocked when Will makes a startling confession after she confronts him over the police taking DNA samples from him.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: Documentary examining the truth behind one of Britain's biggest issues - immigrants coming to the UK and living on benefits. As EU work restrictions are lifted, this film tracks a group of new arrivals from their Roma village to London, and members of Roma families already established in the UK talk about their experiences.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Series 4 - 3. Ka 'Oia'i'o Ma Loko (The Truth Within)
programme.desc: The cops are puzzled by the murder of a wealthy couple and a missing artefact linked to the Royal League, a long-forgotten secret society. A conspiracy theorist (played by Jorge Garcia, Lost) thinks he knows what's going on, but should he be trusted? Meanwhile, Catherine spends her last day with the Navy. Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan and Michelle Borth star.(n)

programme.desc: Chin awakes to find he has been kidnapped and transported to Halawa prison, where he hopes not to be recognised by the inmates he is partly responsible for convicting. Meanwhile, Kono's suspicions about Michael increase following a strange phone call.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.desc: A man driving a large 4x4 vehicle is spotted using a mobile phone, but when police signal for him to pull over, he leads them on a death-defying chase through the back streets of Swansea, culminating in a lucky escape for one pursuing officer. Jamie Theakston narrates.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? USA
programme.desc: New Girl star Zooey Deschanel travels to Philadelphia to explore the family's Quaker heritage and learn the story of her ancestral grandmother Sarah Pownall, a committed abolitionist at a time when such political views led to public condemnation. The actress travels to the site of the family's farm deep in the Pennsylvania countryside, where she discovers the extent of the Pownalls' commitment to their cause.(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Pawn
programme.desc: Yossi Dina negotiates as he aims to acquire a rare 17th-century executioner's sword, and travels out west to meet a modern-day cowboy as he searches for the perfect high-end saddle.(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Pawn
programme.sub-title: Series 3 - 12. A Banksy and a Bombshell
programme.desc: Yossi Dina tries to sell a piece of street-art thought to have been produced by the elusive artist Banksy, and is presented with a fur coat that may have once been Marilyn Monroe's.(n)

programme.title: Nick Knowles' Original Features
programme.desc: Nick Knowles presents more restorations of buildings with an interesting tale to tell. Near the Severn Bridge, a couple's work to rejuvenate a Victorian wreck reveals many hidden treasures.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A man driving a large 4x4 vehicle is spotted using a mobile phone, but when police signal for him to pull over, he leads them on a death-defying chase through the back streets of Swansea, culminating in a lucky escape for one pursuing officer. Jamie Theakston narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Banksy renews acquaintance with the Sissoulu family after a telephone used to tip off the police about a murder is traced back to grieving father Joseph, whose son Danny was recently killed in a similar manner. The dead teenager's friends are reluctant to say much, but suspicion falls on Mo Campbell when his prints are found in the newsagent's shop.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? USA
programme.desc: New Girl star Zooey Deschanel travels to Philadelphia to explore the family's Quaker heritage and learn the story of her ancestral grandmother Sarah Pownall, a committed abolitionist at a time when such political views led to public condemnation. The actress travels to the site of the family's farm deep in the Pennsylvania countryside, where she discovers the extent of the Pownalls' commitment to their cause.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dalek Sec is reborn in human form and plans to create a new race of hybrids in 1930s New York. As Sec's human side takes hold, the Doctor sees a chance to permanently alter the evil nature of his old enemies - but the other Daleks have plans of their own. Andrew Garfield and Hugh Quarshie guest star.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef Canada
programme.desc: The remaining cooks tackle another Mystery Box Challenge, observed by families and friends, for the chance to assign a piece of culinary equipment for the next elimination round.(n)

programme.title: The Glades
programme.desc: Children collecting dragonflies stumble upon the corpse of a US navy recruiter, and Carlos's lover Callie is assigned to the unit as a forensic nurse. Crime drama, starring Matt Passmore, Kiele Sanchez and Carlos Gomez.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: The illusionist's stage show, recorded at the Garrick Theatre in London during his 2008 nationwide tour. Derren takes viewers and the audience on a journey through mind-control and subliminal suggestion, and re-creates the oracle act from the turn of the 20th century, in which performers would reveal information about individuals that only they themselves could know. The show features audience participation, stunts and mind-boggling games.(n)

programme.title: Saving Hope
programme.desc: Alex is forced to tell a bride-to-be that she does not have long to live, while Joel treats a heroin addict infected with a flesh-eating virus. Supernatural medical drama, with Erica Durance and Michael Shanks.(n)

programme.title: Road Patrol Australia 05 August 2015 Watch| Series 1 - Episode 5
programme.desc: Documentary series following police officers in New South Wales as they deal with drink-driving.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer return with their usual brand of silliness, with team captains Will Self and Radio 1's Sara Cox standing in for regular Ulrika Jonsson. Their guests are Lisa Snowdon, Neil Hamilton and Liz Smith, along with permanent team member Johnny Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Stewart Lee's Comedy Vehicle
programme.desc: The comedian's stand-up routine focuses on the theme of political correctness and looks at whether people really understand what the term means. He talks about the problems caused by his attempts to lose weight and reveals how a lost ballet shoe caused a national scandal. Featuring sketches and an ensemble cast.(n)

programme.title: Stella Street
programme.desc: The stars hold a crisis meeting to call a halt to the intrusive celebrity tours plaguing their lives. However, no one can agree on a solution until Joe Pesci solves the problem in his own way. John Sessions and Phil Cornwell star.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola accepts an invitation to debate with her shadow Peter Mannion on Richard Bacon's late-night Radio 5 Live programme. However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam (Ashes to Ashes).(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: With the prime minister away at a summit in Spain, the media starts to consider Nicola as a potential challenger for the party leadership. Malcolm is forced to put aside his responsibilities running the country so he can thwart the rumours and the minister's new-found ambition - just as she is about to launch her `fourth sector' initiative. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Series 8 - 7. Death Takes a Holiday on Ice
programme.desc: Carla receives a phone call telling her that her husband Eddie has been killed in a freak accident. At his funeral, she makes a chilling discovery. American comedy, starring Rhea Perlman.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with classic sketches Ham It Up and Last Mango in Paris. Guests include John Harvey and Julia McKenzie, with music by Manhattan Transfer.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp
programme.desc: The big-collared comedian presents a compilation episode with highlights from previous series. Including appearances by Al Murray, Duncan Goodhew, Judy Finnegan and Burger Barry from Booze Britain.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben buys the house next door, thinking it will be a great investment, but discovers squatters at the property, and quickly offloads it on to Roger. However, all is not as it seems and he soon regrets the decision. Meanwhile, Susan tries to find a girlfriend for luckless Michael.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael goes on a military cadet weekend, leaving Susan to brood over an empty house, so it is no surprise when she takes pity on a stray dog - much to Ben's disgust. After Janey clears the loft of her belongings, her father accidentally discards a teddy bear worth hundreds of pounds.(n)

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.sub-title: Series 8 - 6. Seance in a Wet Rag and Bone Yard

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: The Cranes cringe over their son's impending circumcision in the traditional Jewish ceremony, and Frasier attempts to rescue him. Meanwhile, Rebecca organises a corporate retirement party for her boss's brother-in-law.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Series 8 - 9. Two Girls for Every Boyd
programme.desc: Woody has trouble with the love scenes in his first starring role, and the regulars hold a beard-growing competition to demonstrate their manhood. Starring Ted Danson and Woody Harrelson.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp 09 August 2015 GOLD| Series 8 - Episode 15
programme.desc: Compilation episode with highlights from previous series. Includes appearances by Bear Grylls and Coronation Street's Dev, a fight between toasters and sharks and Harry refereeing a fight to determine which is better - dog sleds or the internet.(n)

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers his expiry date is less than 24 hours away, prompting Lister and Rimmer to organise a party he will never forget, but when the mechanoid decides to avoid being shut down he does not realise his actions could cost the rest of the crew their lives. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: Gary faces up to the prospect of fatherhood in two eras 55 years apart, as the mothers of his children continually nag him about his responsibilities - and make demands on his bank balance. Emma Amos and Elizabeth Carling take over the roles of Yvonne and Phoebe respectively.(n)

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1973. Harold decides to spend the festive season in Majorca and promptly heads off to the travel agent - then faces the grim task of telling Albert he'll be alone for the holidays. When his plans fall through, he decides to throw a party at home instead. Starring Harry H Corbett, Wilfrid Brambell and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Series 3 - 5. May the Force Be with You
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.sub-title: Series 6 - 7. The Art of Being Susan

programme.title: My Family

programme.title: dinnerladies

programme.desc: Family fun and games with the Brockmans, as Sue has an ongoing battle with a printer that seems to have a mind of its own, while Ben becomes fascinated by the world of psychology. programme.desc: Actor and wheelchair sportsman Peter Mitchell, who was paralysed in a car crash, follows the stories of three young people who have battled to survive a life-changing illness or injury and are fighting to access the support they need to live the life they want. Peter also meets Jacob, from Preston, who made the decision to have his legs amputated following a battle with meningitis and who is discovering that without an accessible car, he is stranded in his own home.(n)

programme.desc: Steve tries to prove his toughness to Stan by adopting the persona of a superhero, while Francine also goes through an identity crisis when she receives news that could change the family for ever.(n)

programme.title: Hive Minds
programme.desc: The Misinformed take on the Mavericks in the last of the first-round heats of the general knowledge quiz in which players not only have to know the answers, but also have to find them hidden in a honeycomb of letters. Fiona Bruce presents.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain
programme.desc: Dr Lucy Worsley marks the 300th anniversary of the Hanoverian succession to the British throne as she reveals the history of Britain under the reigns of George I and George II. She is given access to treasure from the Royal Collection prior to the opening of a new exhibition at the Queen's Gallery, Buckingham Palace, to give a personal insight into the monarchs' lives, and begins by charting the story of George I's feuding family.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: An insight into the Sherpa community, focusing on the lives of mountain guides Phurba, Ngima, Ngima Tenji and Gelu, who reveal the reality of their daily lives with their families after they return home from climbing expeditions, where their feats have become the stuff of legend. Generally secretive about their nation, culture and customs, this film provides a glimpse into the real heroes of Mount Everest.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey from Southampton to the West Midlands, Michael Portillo visits the spa town of Cheltenham, where he gets behind the wheel of a very early locomotive carriage that ran on the road. In Tewkesbury, he joins a group re-enacting a battle from the Wars of the Roses, before he reaches his final destination of Wolverhampton, where he hears how Queen Victoria made an emotional visit that signalled the end of her exile from public life after mourning Prince Albert.(n)

programme.title: Gardens in Time
programme.sub-title: Series 1 - 3. British Gardens in Time: Biddulph Grange
programme.desc: An exploration of Biddulph Grange in Staffordshire, which was created in Victorian times at the height of the British Empire and comprises areas dedicated to different countries across the world. Biddulph was developed by James Bateman, who was fascinated by new technology and discoveries, but this passion came into conflict with his religious beliefs - and led him into open conflict with naturalist Charles Darwin, financial ruin and the eventual loss of his garden.(n)

programme.title: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.sub-title: Series 1 - 1. The Buddha: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes investigates the ideas of ancient philosophers, starting with the Indian nobleman Siddhartha Gautama, more popularly known as Buddha. Thought to have been lived and tought between the sixth and fourth centuries BC, the sage and holy man inspired a diverse belief system that influences the lives of millions of people to this day. She travels to India, where Buddha experienced the challenging ideas and extreme methods of wandering `truth seekers', after he had abandoned his family and homeland in the Himalayas to embark on his philosophical quest to find a solution to human suffering.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Series 30 - 13. Natural World: The Real Jungle Book Bear
programme.desc: The life of a young male sloth bear as he grows up in the harsh landscape of the Indian state of Karnataka. Like his fictional counterpart in the famous novel and movie adaptations, it eats ants and other insects - but unlike the Disney character, life is much tougher as he fends off foes and searches for food. The film also meets the bear's mother who lives nearby with two new cubs on her back, trying to keep them safe from prowling leopards.(n)

programme.title: Radio Times
programme.desc: Lars Tharp explores the enduring popularity of Chinese porcelain in European auction houses, and investigates why demand for such items rose dramatically in the 18th century. He visits Mount Gaolin, where many of the most popular pieces began life, to discover how items such as vases and crockery are manufactured, before heading to the city of Jingdezhen, the centre of the country's porcelain trade. Lars also examines the ways in which demand for certain designs influenced aesthetic tastes in both Europe and China.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Charlie injures his back and refuses to let his chiropractor brother help him. Seeking medical advice, he finds out his new doctor is a beautiful woman - but does not realise they have met before. Starring Charlie Sheen, Jon Cryer and Angus T Jones.(n)

programme.title: Fake Reaction
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson hosts the comedy panel show in which captains Joe Swash and Ellie Taylor, along with Coronation Street's Mikey North, former TOWIE star Kirk Norcross, TV presenter Laura Whitmore and comedian Tom Deacon, try to keep straight faces and earn points for their teams while secretly enduring anything from an electric shock to having a bird peck food off their head.(n)

programme.desc: The teams compete to make the most impressive cheesy dishes before Gordon Ramsay awards the winners an ocean adventure. Later, divisions between the strong and weak contestants grow during another star-studded dinner service.(n)

programme.desc: Hour-long episode. The day of the wedding dawns, and Debbie remains terrified that her secrets will be exposed on the big day. Two of the missives have led to suicides - but Miss Marple suspects there is more to the deaths than meets the eye. Murder mystery with an all-star cast, featuring Geraldine McEwan, James D'Arcy, Emilia Fox, Imogen Stubbs and Ken Russell.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An encounter with a gang of armed men presents Miller with a difficult dilemma that puts his professional and personal future in jeopardy. Mason and Wetherby struggle to deal with student protesters who are furious at the presence of a suspected Nazi collaborator in the town, and the situation escalates further when an attempt is made on the man's life. John Duttine and Joe McFadden star.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A local nightclub owner is admitted with symptoms of poisoning, and his son is quick to point the finger of suspicion at his father's glamorous wife. Frankie is shocked to see Dr Ormerod doubt himself as they tend a drunken farmer after a tractor accident, while Dr Goodwin deals with a case of domestic abuse and a stationery salesman takes a shine to Lizzie. Robert Daws and Scott Taylor star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's car breaks down, leaving her stranded in the middle of nowhere, and she is forced to take a bus - unaware that one of her fellow passengers is a murderer. Guest starring Linda Blair (The Exorcist).(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: Series 2 - 4. By the Pricking of My Thumbs
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster meets fellow enthusiasts Tommy and Tuppence at a nursing home, where the ramblings of an elderly resident prompt them to join forces and investigate the unsolved mystery of a murdered child. The trail leads to the Norfolk village of Farrell St Edmund, a community harbouring sinister secrets and tales of heartbreak. Geraldine McEwan heads an all-star cast, including Greta Scacchi, Anthony Andrews, Charles Dance, June Whitfield and Claire Bloom.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A notorious burglar escapes from prison and returns to Aidensfield to pursue a vendetta against Ashfordly police. Roping in two local boys, the villain dupes them into helping him carry out his plan while PC Mason desperately tries to find him before he strikes again. Dawn sets Joyce up on a date with PC Younger - but is oblivious to the fact that the young copper actually has feelings for her. George Cole guest stars, with Joe McFadden and John Duttine.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Goodwin is accused of taking sides when he goes too far to help a woman who claims her husband is hitting her, and there is a mystery to solve when a patient is admitted under a false name. Meanwhile, Dr Ormerod's strange behaviour shows signs of becoming worse - and Frankie fears the surgeon is becoming addicted to his medication. Medical drama, with Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Amy Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Feature-length finale of the African-set wildlife drama. It's New Year's Eve and Alice has returned to Leopard's Den, but the stress of combining work with caring for a baby is causing tension between her and Danny. They then receive devastating news - two cheetahs have been taken by poachers. With only days until the wedding of Rosie and Dylan - who isn't endearing himself to anybody - tempers are already running high when Du Plessis finds out his heart is weak. Realising he must use his remaining time to help the family, he persuades pilot Dylan to fly them all to Zimbabwe to rescue the stolen animals in the hope that the trip will convince Danny his future son-in-law is worthy. Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Lucy-Jo Hudson and Hayley Mills star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: In Loving Memory
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his birthday with a drink - on the day he and Ivy are in the docks at court. Comedy set in an undertakers, starring Thora Hird.(n)

programme.title: Doctor at Large
programme.desc: Paul messes up his oral exam in anatomy when he picks a fight with the examining professor.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby lets a room to a young couple he believes have just got married - unaware that they are not man and wife. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: Cornwall with Caroline Quentin 05 August 2015 ITV3| Series 2 - Episode 3
programme.desc: The actress finds out about life on a cider farm and helps Toby Roskilly produce a new flavour of ice-cream on the Lizard Peninsula, while Pip, the guardian to one of Cornwall's oldest country estates, asks his family to assist in a spot of hedge construction.(n)

programme.title: Richard Wilson on the Road
programme.desc: The One Foot in the Grave star drives his vintage car around Dorset with his trusty 1936 guidebook on board. His first stop is the coast at Studland on the Isle of Purbeck, where he has a surprising encounter with a local. He then explores the Jurassic Coast and calls in at the former home of one of the county's most famous residents - Thomas Hardy - before being schooled in the local dialect.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family 05 August 2015 ITV3| Series 2 - Episode 6
programme.desc: When she was 30, Fiona Dunn found out that she had a younger sister her family had kept secret from her. Three decades later she hopes to meet her sibling and make up for lost time. Anne Clegg enjoyed a happy childhood but always longed to know her birth mother, who gave her up for adoption 48 years earlier. Anne has done everything in her power to track down her natural mum, but to no avail, so she calls on Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell for assistance.(n)

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Janine finds herself coming into conflict with her daughter Ellie when she investigates the murder of charismatic singer Jack Taylor, who has been found dead at his apartment. She soon learns that the vocalist had difficult relationships with those close to him, and his girlfriend Amy (former Coronation Street actor Tina O'Brien) becomes a suspect. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: As Joe returns to the Vice Unit, his first job is to nail a violent pimp - a case he doesn't think is going to stretch him too much. However, the operation runs into difficulties when the mother of one of the prostitutes involved recognises Vickers and threatens to expose some of his extracurricular activities unless he deals with the case personally. Gritty drama, starring David Harewood and Tim Pigott-Smith.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur does a profitable deal on a fireplace and Terry has to mind a dodgy bookie, putting a damper on his blossoming romance with latest girlfriend Dolly. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

With the future of the division in question, Bodie and Doyle try to prove the family's drug-trade connection and the real reason behind the man's death. Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins star.(n)

Comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man looks to buy a baseball signed by 1951 World Series Champions the New York Yankees, but first needs to verify its authenticity. programme.title: Village of the Damned
programme.desc: Science-fiction horror, an updated version of the classic British chiller, starring Christopher Reeve and Kirstie Alley. The unsettling discovery that all the women in a sleepy California village have become simultaneously pregnant is compounded by the disturbing abilities of the children they give birth to. In just a few years the youngsters are influencing the adults around them to horrific effect.(n)
